intro: Persicaria minor subsp. subsessilis, commonly known as narrowleaf smartweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swales, and along stream banks. The plant features slender, upright stems with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are usually less than 2 cm in width. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in dense clusters at the tips of the stems. This subspecies is distinguished by its reduced leaf stalks and is often found in wetland ecosystems.
